basics.name: Giuliano Langella
basics.label: Associate Professor in Pedometrics and Pedoinformatics
basics.summary: Associate Professor in Pedometrics and Pedoinformatics at the University of Naples Federico II. His research spans geostatistics, artificial intelligence, digital soil mapping, and decision support systems for sustainable land management. With a background in environmental informatics and a taste for hands-on innovation, he leads national and EU-funded projects to bridge science, technology, and policy.

work.summary: Teaching and research in pedology, digital soil mapping, and geospatial decision support systems. Coordinator of multiple national and EU projects (e.g. Agritech, FAIR-EASE, Soils4Med).
highlights: Leader of WP2.3 in PNRR Agritech

publications.name: AgriMetSupport: A Cyber-Physical System for interoperable agro-meteorological data processing and integration
publications.summary: AgriMetSupport introduces a modular cyber-physical system for managing, processing, and integrating heterogeneous agro-meteorological data in an interoperable framework.

publications.name: A smart soil framework law proposal from Italy: Bridging the gap between policy and implementation
publications.summary: The paper proposes a national smart soil law framework that connects soil policy with digital infrastructures for sustainable land management.

publications.name: Datacubes as enabler for advanced decision support systems in land management
publications.summary: This work highlights how datacube technologies can serve as a foundation for next-generation spatial decision support systems in land and environmental management.

publications.name: Integrated, multiscale forensic soil science applied to an unsolved murder case in Italy
publications.summary: An application of forensic soil science integrating morphological, chemical, and geospatial analyses to support an Italian criminal investigation.

publications.name: ReFuse: Generating Imperviousness Maps from Multi-Spectral Sentinel-2 Satellite Imagery
publications.summary: ReFuse presents a deep learning approach for generating high-accuracy imperviousness maps from Sentinel-2 imagery, enabling frequent and scalable urban monitoring.

publications.name: Soil Monitor: an internet platform to challenge soil sealing in Italy
publications.summary: The Soil Monitor platform is presented as a national-scale tool for monitoring and accounting soil sealing using high-resolution data and cloud infrastructure.

publications.name: Spatial analysis of clay content in soils using neurocomputing and pedological support: a case study of Valle Telesina (South Italy)
publications.summary: This study demonstrates the use of ensemble artificial neural networks for predicting soil clay content, improving spatial accuracy through pedological integration.

publications.name: A physically oriented approach to analysis and mapping of terroirs
publications.summary: A physically based framework for characterizing and mapping viticultural terroirs, integrating soil and hydrological properties with environmental data.

publications.name: High-resolution space–time rainfall analysis using integrated ANN inference systems
publications.summary: A neural-network-based framework for high-resolution rainfall reconstruction using hybrid inference and geostatistical filtering methods.
